name: Tuna Steak
description: Recipe video above. The perfect tuna steak is seared on the outside and deliciously rare on the inside. It takes 2 1/2 minutes flat - fastest fish recipe ever! Tuna loin is lean so best served raw or rare if cooked, to enjoy the tender, almost creamy flesh. There's a reason why tuna is a darling of the fine dining scene! Best served just slightly warm or at room temperature. Pictured with Sauce Vierge, a summery, simple French salsa / vinaigerette sauce that pairs perfectly with fish!
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp olive oil (, or oil spray)
Sauce Vierge ((French salsa / vinaigrette for fish))
Chervil sprigs ((substitute small flat leaf or curly parsley leaves) or small edible flowers (optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare resting tray: Place a rack on a tray. (Note 3)
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare resting tray: Place a rack on a tray. (Note 3)

recipeInstructions.text: Oil and season tuna: Drizzle half the oil over the tuna. Smear over one side, then sprinkle with half the salt and pepper. Flip and repeat.
recipeInstructions.name: Oil and season tuna: Drizzle half the oil over the tuna. Smear over one side, then sprinkle with half the salt and pepper. Flip and repeat.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat skillet: Heat skillet (preferably a skillet with grille lines) over high heat until smoking hot. The hotter, the better!
recipeInstructions.name: Heat skillet: Heat skillet (preferably a skillet with grille lines) over high heat until smoking hot. The hotter, the better!

recipeInstructions.text: Oil skillet (if required): If your skillet is not well-seasoned, brush skillet with olive oil or take pan off stove and spray with any oil (SAFETY WARNING! Note 4)
recipeInstructions.name: Oil skillet (if required): If your skillet is not well-seasoned, brush skillet with olive oil or take pan off stove and spray with any oil (SAFETY WARNING! Note 4)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook first side: Place tuna steak in the skillet (I do one at a time for best results, Note 5) and cook for 45 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook first side: Place tuna steak in the skillet (I do one at a time for best results, Note 5) and cook for 45 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Rotate for grill lines:  Turn steak 45 degree. Continue cooking another 45 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Rotate for grill lines:  Turn steak 45 degree. Continue cooking another 45 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook other side: Flip tuna carefully, then leave for 1 minute or until the internal temperature in the middle reads 48°C / 118°F (Note 6).
recipeInstructions.name: Cook other side: Flip tuna carefully, then leave for 1 minute or until the internal temperature in the middle reads 48°C / 118°F (Note 6).

recipeInstructions.text: Rest: Remove tuna from skillet and place on rack. Rest for 5 minutes – it will cool down almost to room temperature. This is desirable for easier slicing and better eating (Note 7) Serve! See Note 2 for sauce options.

Plating up - with Sauce Vierge option (pictured):

itemListElement.text: Slice, if desired (Note 7): Place tuna on a board with criss-crossing grill lines facing up. Slice the tuna into 4 or 5 thick slices, holding the edges with your fingers as needed to ensure the seared surface doesn't crumble. Transfer to serving plate and separate the slices slightly so they insides are just visible, or on an a slightly angle, overlapping each other.

itemListElement.text: Sauce Vierge: Spoon the Sauce Vierge over steaks, leaving small piles of tomato here and there on the tuna slices, and a few on the plate. Other sauce options: See Note 2.

itemListElement.text: Finishing: Drizzle with a bit of olive oil. It looks beautiful as it is, but if you want to raise the bar even higher, add a few small sprigs of chervil and some edible flowers!

review.reviewBody: Instructions result in perfectly cooked Tuna, and the Sauce Vierge complements the fish so well.

I have tried too many times to “do” tuna.  This is the first time it has actually worked…perfectly!  I used the timer on my phone, followed the directions EXACTLY, including the 5 minute rest, and , and it was perfect.  I made a little sauce with fresh lime juice, soy sauce and sesame oil.
Oops!  Forgot to put 5 stars!  Wish I could give 6!

Thank you so much for this recipe!  At the grocery store, they had ahi tuna steaks on sale, so I looked up this recipe on your blog and decided to buy them.  I made them with the lemon vinaigrette, and I can't believe how easy and delicious they were.  I will definitely make these again (though I usually make everything I try from you blog again!).  Thanks for your amazing recipes, and please do a book tour in the US!
Super super super! My family just loved it! Thanks a lot of an awesome recipe. Big fan of all ur recipes. Keep posting new ones. Can wait to try them all.
Perfect recipe and instructions! We made Sauce Vierge with it, but as a whole salad instead of just a sauce. Delicious! Thank you Nagi, your recipes are the best!
